@description.name: @description
@description.body: Applies the cell styles to the style map.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
condition {Array}
   The matched condition
@param.description: The matched condition

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
style {Map}
   map of already applied styles.
@param.description: map of already applied styles.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The addNumericCondition method is used to add a basic numeric condition to the cell renderer. Note: Passing null is different from passing an empty string in the align, color, style and weight arguments. Null will allow pre-existing formatting to pass through, where an empty string will clear it back to the default formatting set in the constructor.

@param.name: @param
@param.description:
The type of condition. Accepted strings are "==", "!=", ">", "<",
   ">=", and "<=".

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
value1 {Integer}
   The value to compare against.
@param.description: The value to compare against.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
align {String}
   The alignment to format the cell with if the condition matches.
@param.description: The alignment to format the cell with if the condition matches.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
color {String}
   The color to format the cell with if the condition matches.
@param.description: The color to format the cell with if the condition matches.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
style {String}
   The style to format the cell with if the condition matches.
@param.description: The style to format the cell with if the condition matches.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
weight {String}
   The weight to format the cell with if the condition matches.
@param.description: The weight to format the cell with if the condition matches.

@param.name: @param
@param.description:
The text value of the column to compare against. If this is null,
   comparisons will be against the contents of this cell.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body:
{Error} If the condition can not be recognized or the value
 is null.
@throws.description:
If the condition can not be recognized or the value
 is null.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The addBetweenCondition method is used to add a between condition to the cell renderer. Note: Passing null is different from passing an empty string in the align, color, style and weight arguments. Null will allow pre-existing formatting to pass through, where an empty string will clear it back to the default formatting set in the constructor.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
condition {String}
   The type of condition. Accepted strings are "between" and "!between".
@param.description: The type of condition. Accepted strings are "between" and "!between".

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
value1 {Integer}
   The first value to compare against.
@param.description: The first value to compare against.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
value2 {Integer}
   The second value to compare against.
@param.description: The second value to compare against.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
align {String}
   The alignment to format the cell with if the condition matches.
@param.description: The alignment to format the cell with if the condition matches.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
color {String}
   The color to format the cell with if the condition matches.
@param.description: The color to format the cell with if the condition matches.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
style {String}
   The style to format the cell with if the condition matches.
@param.description: The style to format the cell with if the condition matches.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
weight {String}
   The weight to format the cell with if the condition matches.
@param.description: The weight to format the cell with if the condition matches.

@param.name: @param
@param.description:
The text value of the column to compare against. If this is null,
   comparisons will be against the contents of this cell.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body:
{Error} If the condition can not recognized or one of the
 values is null.
@throws.description:
If the condition can not recognized or one of the
 values is null.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The addRegex method is used to add a regular expression condition to the cell renderer. Note: Passing null is different from passing an empty string in the align, color, style and weight arguments. Null will allow pre-existing formatting to pass through, where an empty string will clear it back to the default formatting set in the constructor.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
regex {String}
   The regular expression to match against.
@param.description: The regular expression to match against.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
align {String}
   The alignment to format the cell with if the condition matches.
@param.description: The alignment to format the cell with if the condition matches.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
color {String}
   The color to format the cell with if the condition matches.
@param.description: The color to format the cell with if the condition matches.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
style {String}
   The style to format the cell with if the condition matches.
@param.description: The style to format the cell with if the condition matches.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
weight {String}
   The weight to format the cell with if the condition matches.
@param.description: The weight to format the cell with if the condition matches.

@param.name: @param
@param.description:
The text value of the column to compare against. If this is null,
   comparisons will be against the contents of this cell.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Overridden; called whenever the cell updates. The cell will iterate through each available condition and apply formatting for those that match. Multiple conditions can match, but later conditions will override earlier ones. Conditions with null values will stack with other conditions that apply to that value.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
cellInfo {Map}
   The information about the cell.  See {@link qx.ui.table.cellrenderer.Abstract#createDataCellHtml}.
@param.description: The information about the cell.  See {@link qx.ui.table.cellrenderer.Abstract#createDataCellHtml}.

@description.name: @description
